revised_title: Revisiting the Classification of Reptilia: A Focus on Skull Roofing and Hind Foot Structure
tldr: The author discusses the classification of reptiles, focusing on skull roofing and hind foot structure. They propose a new phylogenetic classification that includes three groups: Protosaurian, Therapsidan, and Diapsidan reptiles. The author emphasizes the importance of the structure of the heart and the skeleton of the hind foot in determining reptile affinities and affirms that the hook-shaped metatarsal is a specialization found in the common ancestor of various reptile orders.
